messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] blogger/blogspot; was Re: best place to blog?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Chrissy, I know that there used to be some unschoolers (and gentle parenting homeschoolers) that used homeschoolblog, but pulled their blogs when
messages.messageBody:
On 9/17/06, Homeschlfor2@... <Homeschlfor2@...> wrote:
> Along these same lines just cause im curious..... why does noone seem to
> use homeschoolblogger? I have tried others and just get confused at how to do
> it. But can use this site well... but when I random blog I never find any
> other unschoolers..... Just curious.
>

Chrissy, I know that there used to be some unschoolers (and gentle
parenting homeschoolers) that used homeschoolblog, but pulled their
blogs when homeschoolblog refused to remove ads to the Pearls, a
controversial discipline/child-rearing authors.

As far as problems with blogger, I haven't ever had any problems with
it. I have had a few times when I have gone to view my blog after a
new post was added and needed to refresh my browser to see it, that's
a caching problem not a blogger problem.

--
Michelle
Michelle Leifur Reid
YOUR Pampered Chef Consultant
850-474-0817
http://www.pamperedchef.biz/michellelr
Check out my homeschool cooking classes!

messages.messageBody:
Along these same lines just cause im curious..... why does noone seem to
use homeschoolblogger? I have tried others and just get confused at how to do
it. But can use this site well... but when I random blog I never find any
other unschoolers..... Just curious.

Chrissy

www.homeschoolblogger.com/chrissyland

messages.subject: blogger/blogspot; was Re: best place to blog?
messages.msgSnippet: I just started an account at blogger/blogspot.  I ve only posted 3 entries in two weeks so far.  I m wondering if any of you blogspot bloggers are using the
messages.messageBody:
I just started an account at blogger/blogspot. I've only posted 3 entries
in two weeks so far. I'm wondering if any of you blogspot bloggers are
using the "beta" version. I read that it is new and small, but it may make
publishing posts easier/quicker? I had a rough start with my blog -
published one post twice, couldn't view the others I thought I'd published.
I think I've worked through all that. Now I'm wondering if I should switch
to this new beta blogger. Any thoughts?

Jenny Canfield







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
